question: It wasn't war. It was something else. Zus eyes him carefully. Where is Sonia and the baby?

question: Where is your gun, farmer?
answer: I have no gun. Zus grabs a dinner plate and SMASHES IT IN THE FARMER'S

question: Hunting can work up a thirst.

answer: My whole life I presumed to teach others the right way to live. I had no doubt

answer: Here... You're not hungry? Aron doesn't respond. The little one does not talk?

question: Did you at least get the gun?
answer: Only four bullets.

question: ...Fucking SS never sleeps... The door OPENS slowly. They all look up.

question: ...what are you talking about?
answer: You have no idea what I'm talking about...

question: Tell them who did this. Riboynoy shel oylam, riboynoy shel oylam... Lord of the universe, forgive me, I have murdered -- but they were monsters and did not deserve to live.

question: His sons. Zus nods his approval.
answer: How was it?

question: No more. I know. I know... Tamara, you remember Cousin Zus. Please, go sit down by the fire. And this is Lazar -- Isabel's youngest... Tamara is pleasant-looking but emotionally wounded. answer: Tuvia, I have pity for them all,

answer: And this one, is she family?

question: Fuck me! Have you never used a hammer?
answer: Uh. No.

question: What is it you do, then?
answer: I suppose...you'd have to say...I was...am...an intellectual.

question: This is a job?
answer: I published a small magazine... actually a journal...well, more like a pamphlet. Zus passes them, his arm around the dark-haired beauty.

answer: This is all the food we have. You are welcome to share.

question: No. I want to see if this little shit will shoot me. You like shooting Jews, you little shit? No. We're the Gestapo, you little shit.

answer: Where are you from? The young man glares at Zus. Then, to Tuvia:

answer: I know.

answer: I don't know.

question: I thought they'd be safe. I should have been with them.

question: We will kill all the Germans you can handle. Starting tonight. They stare up at him, his face a mask of blood and filth. If you're not afraid to use that rifle.

question: 'Vengeance is mine.' Who said that?

answer: We cannot become...like them.

question: If only... Are you coming with us or not?
answer: Us?

question: Peretz and Jacov.

question: Into the fields! RUN! Tuvia pulls Peretz off the road, but Jacov reloads his rifle and begins to FIRE at the approaching trucks. Jacov, NO! THE TRUCKS STOP. His rifle. Zus races back to pick up Peretz's weapon. Asael... He rips the rifle from Zus's hands. For a moment we think he's going to go back after him. Instead, he wedges the rifle into a tree-trunk and takes careful aim...
answer: They thought you were bringing food. Tuvia just stares at him. Did the farmers stop you? Still no answer from Tuvia. They had guns? Dogs?

question: No.
answer: I don't understand. Tuvia says nothing. Nearby, a child cries in hunger. The Talmud says if you save a life you must take responsibility for it.

question: Again I have no idea what you are talking about. Around them, the beseeching eyes of so many hungry faces.
answer: I think you do.

question: You shit! You worthless shit! Zus punches him, knocking him the ground. In a sloppy, drunken frenzy, Zus SLAPS him again.
answer: Enough!

question: He walked right by you! Someone could have been killed! Tuvia pulls Zus off him.

question: If we were real partisans he'd be shot.

question: We need to know what's going on in the villages, how the Germans patrol, who the informers are-- He realizes that Asael is not fully concentrating; instead he is watching as Chaya walks past. Are you listening to me?

answer: Chaya.

question: So talk to her.
answer: I hardly know her.

question: You spent three days in a cellar! Asael blushes, returns the focus to their prior conversation.

answer: Zus.

question: I don't think we've been properly introduced. Arkady Lubczanski.
answer: Hello.

question: You are Chaya?
answer: ...Yes.

answer: Oh. Well... Yes, that would be nice.

question: You'll have it by tonight. Something nice and soft. I couldn't help but notice you don't have a husband yet.
answer: Yet?

question: Most of the woman have already chosen. They haven't told you about this?
answer: No. But thank you for explaining it. She hurries away. Malbin sits down wearily beside Shimon.

question: Jacob's ladders. Like in his dream. Asael says you can see the angels. They walk on, eventually coming upon RAILROAD TRACKS. A TRAIN is rounding the bend, headed in their direction.
answer: Can we stay to watch?

question: If we hide. They move back into the trees as the train NEARS
answer: Is that a Nazi train?

question: If we had some dynamite we could blow the shit out of it.
answer: (with undisguised

question: You have lipstick? Please, I know you have some left. Chaya digs in her pocket and produces a tiny remnant. Bella dabs it on and casually approaches Zus, who is on guard duty. May I join you?
answer: Of course.

question: You get lonely out here?
answer: I like the woods. LAUGHTER and MUSIC waft through the trees.

question: I'm a little scared out here. Zus knows an opportunity when he sees one. He offers her a drink from his bottle of vodka. I've never tried it.
answer: Go ahead. She drinks, refuses to grimace. Drinks again. Zus laughs. - Bella touches the rifle in his arms.

question: Why is there a rule against women having guns?
answer: There aren't enough for the men.

question: Women need guns, too.
answer: What for?

question: For protection.
answer: Women have men for protection. Bella bites her lip. She's a virgin but also realistic.

question: KARELITZ! The confrontation changes languages.
answer: I'M FROM KARELITZ, TOO. I LIVED BY

question: MAYBE I KNOW YOU. SHOW YOURSELF!
answer: YOU FIRST! Derisive laughter from the trees.

question: You are from Belarussia, pig! Why do you work for the Germans against your own people?
answer: Next one is to the head!

question: Soon it will be dark... See how you find your way home then! The policemen are having similar thoughts. They'll be back. We have to find a new camp.
answer: Next time just draw them a map.

question: What does that mean?
answer: It means -- we should have killed the fucking milkman. Your policy of diplomacy is shit. Zus is breathing hard, full of the adrenaline of battle. ...Two are dead. Winter is coming and now we have no shelter. Why? Because you don't have the stomach to do what must be done. He walks away.

question: I'm sure we can clear up this misunderstanding with your commander.
answer: I am Viktor Panchenko, commander of the October otriad. We have had complaints of a Jewish gang stealing from villages loyal to us. How do you respond to these charges?

answer: We are soldiers.

answer: We will see. Select your best fighters and send them to us. Zus looks at Tuvia, knowing he has no choice.

question: As if we have a choice. (throwing a smaller
answer: If my friends at The New Socialists' Club could see me now... I haven't read a book in months.

answer: .I did. Tuvia laughs ruefully. Considers him for a moment.

answer: Who else? Tuvia nods. Good point. They continue working. Might I make an observation? Tuvia gestures, go ahead. We need to be strong, but--

answer: Other things are important, too.

question: Such as? Malbin tries to think how best to put it.
answer: Community. Tuvia considers the word. As if trying it on for size.

question: You have more ideas? About all this?
answer: ...A few.

question: And what exactly does that mean, 'do what we can.'
answer: We must send for whoever is left alive.

question: And if it is a hundred? Six hundred?
answer: Then we will provide.

question: And when the Germans follow these hundreds and slaughter us.
answer: I won't let that happen. Tuvia exchanges a glance with Malbin. Zus catches it. He has sensed Malbin's growing influence.

question: You won't let that happen.
answer: No. I'll bring them out myself.

question: From the ghetto.
answer: Yes.

question: Pan Tuvia. Rabbi Tuvia. Allow me to kiss your hand... Tuvia tries to pull his hand away, but Zus holds him. You think Pachenko wants hundreds more of us in the forest?
answer: I cannot have you contradicting me... Not when others are around. Our family must stick together.

question: And who is it that's risking our family, and for what? For the sake of these-- (gestures at the new
answer: Don't call them that.

Zus glares at him, but tries to control himself. --Is it love Zus? You are the man of her dreams? The Romeo of Novagrudok? Zus can't take anymore. Ben Zion moves to break it up. Tuvia and Zus turn on him.

question: And bubbles.

answer: Shoes, Riva?

question: Hello, Chaya.
answer: Hello, Asael.

answer: Wash clothes? I... don't think so. An awkward moment as he stands there watching her.

question: Chaya... I...was...wondering...if... maybe...you...I mean... you and I--
answer: I accept.

question: You do?
answer: I do.

answer: That is so...Russian. He cracks open another bottle and takes a big slug.

answer: .Asael?

question: Lilka?
answer: Sorry, Tuvia. I was...thinking. It's nothing. He looks at her intently, knowing there's more. ...Every time new people come into camp, I keep hoping... even though, I know... (her teeth are

question: Here... He takes off his wool coat and puts it around her shoulders.

question: Yes, yes, my Hebrew warrior. Except for the troops in Stankiewcze and the machine guns out front. THE TENT FLAP OPENS. Tuvia enters. He has developed a cough. Two Bielski's in one room! To what do we owe this honor?
answer: We have sickness. I need ampicillin.

question: This medicine is reserved for fighters.
answer: If typhus breaks out in our camp, it may spread to yours.

answer: I must insist. Comrade.

answer: Of course. Zus grabs his submachine gun.

question: Krensky, Ben Zion. Let's go. Well... He looks into the back where the others wait, anxiously clutching their weapons. Tuvia tries to hold back a cough. Stay with the truck. And make sure it's in gear when we get back.
answer: I'm going in with you.

question: I give the orders tonight. Across the square, the police station looms.
answer: You don't have to do this.

answer: So more die. They will anyway. A grim smile from Zus. Tuvia is broken up inside.

question: I have been given this mission by my superior officer. He starts to get out the cab. Tuvia reaches into his pocket, takes out the mezuzah that once blessed their parents' home.
answer: Zus... For luck. Zuz pockets it and joins the others creeping into the shadows. But rather than follow them into the police station, we HOLD on Tuvia's face. Suddenly we HEAR The sound of gunfire. Then nothing. Ten seconds. More gunfire. Twenty. It is excruciating. Thirty. The longest CLOSE-UP in film history.

question: Go. GO!
answer: What about the others?!

question: GO, DAMN YOU! Medicine.
answer: The others?

question: Fighters die so that malbushim may live, that's what you believe, yes? Tuvia absorbs the accusation as if taking a punch.

answer: Come back to us. Zus won't look at him. You are my brother.

question: This matter is settled. Everybody back in line. People are staring at him. WHAT ARE YOU LOOKING AT? BACK IN
answer: Tuvia, I would never--

answer: ...that you drink too much and are no longer fit to lead us.

answer: I miss him.

question: Not easy being the big boss. Moses was a lonely man when he led us out of bondage.
answer: ...Moses.

question: So I'm a sucker for a biblical allusion. But what is society without leaders. Without leaders, we falter.
answer: I am not a leader.

question: Lova, what happened? Who did this? Lova sits and buries his head in his hands. Lova. Tell me. Who?

answer: They said they wouldn't shit in the same hole as a Jew. Zus gets to his feet.

question: Your fever broke in the night. The medicine helped.

question: I'm sorry.

question: You know Chopin?
answer: Who doesn't? Chopin the butcher from Novogrudok. Thank you, Lilka.

question: I will piss on your head and you will say it's raining. Eat it. The rest of Lubczanski's cabal laughs. TUVIA emerges from his bunker. The first thing he sees is Asael, whose face is BATTERED AND SWOLLEN.

question: You are no longer Commander. Sorry. Tuvia nods, considering his remark for a moment.

question: Join us. At least the sun is warm. Tamara?
answer: I can't, Lilka... I'm pregnant.

question: I had no idea.

answer: No. You mustn't tell him!

question: You call that a move?

question: Do you hear that?
answer: She promises not to take extra food...

question: I cannot allow it. He turns away.
answer: You must let it live!

question: I cannot keep the living alive. Tamara and the man who fathered this child are responsible for its fate.
answer: She was raped by the Nazis. Tuvia closes his eyes. He is tired of being in charge, tired of being the arbiter of other peoples' fate. ...You tell us to hold onto our humanity. Not to become like animals. What better way than by bringing a life into this world of suffering and death. It's our only hope. Tuvia is undone by her intensity. The very nearness of her. The smell of her newly-washed hair. The glow of her skin. He looks at her. And nods in surrender. Thank you, Tuvia. She kisses him. A chaste kiss of gratitude. She pulls back and they look into each other's eyes. The next kiss is something entirely different.

question: Lilka...
answer: I knew what was expected of the women here -- yet you never touched me...

question: Shhh..
answer: I'm not afraid of anything, Tuvia. I'm not even afraid of you. They kiss deeply.

answer: It doesn't matter. If I had stayed in the ghetto I'd be dead. You saved my life.

question: You found these on the prisoner? Tuvia nods. Viktor studies the scout's documents. Tisking.
answer: We can't fight an entire division.

question: The battle on the Eastern Front has begun. The more troops we engage here, the fewer they have to attack the Motherland.

question: My orders are to take command of all partisan operations. You will bring the rest of your fighters to me.

answer: And if I refuse?

question: Did it see us?
answer: Tomorrow is Passover. Yes?

question: ...How should I know?
answer: Moses. The Exodus. Malbin doesn't get it at first. --He left before Pharaoh could stop them. Now Malbin understands. He looks at Shimon.

question: You want to move them all? The old, the sick. They'll never make it. It isn't the first time Tuvia has consigned people to their death, and apparently it won't be the last.
answer: We leave now. Spread the word.

question: TAKE COVER!
answer: Are you alright? Tuvia shakes his head, points to his ears. He cannot hear. ARE...YOU...ALRIGHT? When Tuvia speaks, his WORDS sound DULL and MUFFLED.

question: MUST...GO!
answer: ...WHAT?

question: Shimon, listen to me, the physical plane is just an illusion. Only the spiritual plane is real.
answer: No. The physical plane is where man acts to redeem himself.

question: You've redeemed yourself enough, you should shut up now.
answer: Look who's talking about shutting up... I need to tell you something.

question: What is it?
answer: You shouldn't think so much. The world around you is beautiful.

question: This world?
answer: Even this one. Tuvia has come to sit beside Lilka. She leans into him.

question: You will hold this crossroads until the brigade has completed its retreat. Zus looks around at the position.
answer: For how long? Panchenko's orders are never to be questioned.

question: Until you are ordered to withdraw.
answer: And if we cannot hold the position? Panchenko looks at Gramov, who stands nearby cradling a submachine gun.

question: Comrade Gramov will enforce discipline, if necessary. Gramov smiles. The implications are clear You have served us well, Comrade.
answer: I am so honored, Comrade. Panchenko wheels his horse and gallops off. Zus and his men take cover in the woods. In the distance we can HEAR the unmistakable SOUND of approaching armor. Lova kneels beside Zus.

question: .Tuvia...
answer: Right here. Shimon is at the end.

question: ...Something...to say...
answer: Shhhh...

question: ...no...please... I almost lost...my faith....but you...were sent..by God..to save us.
answer: Ridiculous.

question: I know... ... But just...in case... .I thank....HIM... .and I thank you. He closes his eyes. It's too much for Tuvia. Hard as he tries, he cannot stop the tears from filling his eyes.
answer: Back to the river! He pushes people down. They cling to the banks, cowering. THOSE WITH WEAPONS take cover, using the embankment as if it were the lip of a trench. They RETURN FIRE -- old men, young women, even some children. Only weapons and ammunition! Spread the word. Tuvia hands him the machine gun.

question: Everybody gather your things! We have to get out of the open! Nearby, Aron removes the machine from the tank and hands it to Zus. Bella approaches. Zus embraces her. Tuvia seizes one of the German rifles. He yells to Shulman. Shulman! Weapons only! Tell them. You've been promoted. Congratulations! Tuvia turns, sees Bella with Zus. They see him. Zus hands Bella the machine gun from the tank and approaches. Where is the rest of your unit?
answer: Good question.

question: You are going back?
answer: No. They look at each other. So much unsaid. No time to say it.

question: We've got to build a new camp. Zus nods.
answer: Perhaps you have room for one more?

question: Don't you hear it?
answer: What...?
